title: Gennadiy Kondrashov
content:
Gennadiy Dmitriyevich Kondrashov (Russian: Геннадий Дмитриевич Кондрашов; born 8 December 1938 in Zugres, Sverdlovsk Oblast) is a retired male hammer thrower, who competed  for the Soviet Union at the 1968 Summer Olympics. He set his personal best (70.52 metres) on 21 July 1968 in Leningrad.

This biographical article relating to Soviet athletics is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it.
